intro: Itatiaia, commonly known as the Brazilian watercress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, green, edible leaves. Itatiaia thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found near streams and in mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and yellow, typical of the Brassicaceae family, and it produces round, green pods that contain seeds.
